history.content:
Yes. They're almost completely unrelated.

--

I am a student who took CS 61B after taking CS 70. I will say that I recommend against it because 61B offers some technical maturity along with an introduction to topics life Graph Theory, Trees, and a few others. However if you have/believe you have a good mathematical maturity, 70 is nothing you can't handle even with 61A/B/C simultaneously. 

--

I am currently in CS 70 right now and I haven't taken CS 61B yet. I'd say MATH 54 is important for understanding many topics in CS 70 such as linearity and regression.

--

I did 70 in my first semester concurrently with 61A and did 61B next semester and didn't have a problem. 70 and 61B are almost completely unrelated so I doubt the order that you take them in will matter.

Yes. They're almost completely unrelated.

My friend wants to know if you can take CS70 before 61B. He is already taking CS61A this semester.
history.subject: CS70 before CS61B?
